trees.name: Oak Tree
trees.description: The English oak is a majestic, long-lived tree with lobed leaves and produces acorns. It's known for supporting a wide range of wildlife.

trees.name: Maple Tree
trees.description: Maples are known for their distinctive lobed leaves and vibrant autumn colors. They vary in size from shrubs to large trees.

trees.name: Pine Tree
trees.description: Pines are evergreen conifers with needle-like leaves, commonly found in forests worldwide. They are valued for their timber and resin.

trees.name: Birch Tree
trees.description: Birches are medium-sized deciduous trees with distinctive white bark and serrated leaves. They are often found in temperate climates.

trees.name: Willow Tree
trees.description: Willows are known for their slender branches and elongated leaves. They thrive near water sources and are often associated with graceful, drooping forms.

trees.name: Cherry Tree
trees.description: Cherry trees are celebrated for their beautiful spring blossoms and, in some varieties, for producing edible cherries.

trees.name: Apple Tree
trees.description: Apple trees are deciduous and are cultivated worldwide for their sweet, pomaceous fruit.

trees.name: Baobab Tree
trees.description: Baobabs are iconic trees native to Africa and Australia, known for their massive trunks and longevity. They are often called 'upside-down trees' due to their appearance.

trees.name: Acacia Tree
trees.description: Acacias are fast-growing trees and shrubs found in tropical and subtropical regions, characterized by their feathery leaves and often bearing thorns.

trees.name: Cedar Tree
trees.description: Cedars are large evergreen conifers with fragrant wood, commonly used in construction and furniture making.

trees.name: Mango Tree
trees.description: Mango trees are tropical evergreens known for their delicious fruit and dense, wide canopies.

trees.name: Coconut Tree
trees.description: Coconut trees are tall palms found in tropical regions, valued for their fruit, which provides coconut water, milk, and oil.
